{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Marketing Manager",
  "description": "At TeKnowledge, we turn complexity into clarity &ndash; and potential into progress. We go beyond problem-solving to transform how you grow. By blending cutting-edge technology with expert insight, we help enterprises, governments and tech vendors tackle their biggest challenges while preparing them for what&rsquo;s next. From strategy to execution, we drive smarter, faster, and more sustained innovation&mdash;empowering organizations with the capability and control to lead with confidence.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Manager&nbsp;

Job Id:&nbsp;2025-17143
Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Job type: Full-time

About the job


	We&rsquo;re seeking an experienced and results-driven Marketing Manager &ndash; GTM (Go-to-Market) to join our Africa regional team. In this role, you&rsquo;ll be responsible for developing and executing integrated field marketing programs that drive demand generation, revenue growth, and brand visibility across the African market.
	At TeKnowledge, your work makes an impact from day one. We partner with organizations to deliver AI-First Expert Technology Services that drive meaningful impact in AI, Customer Experience, and Cybersecurity. We turn complexity into clarity and potential into progress&mdash;in a place where people lead and tech empowers.


Responsibilities


	Develop and Execute Integrated GTM Programs: Plan, budget, and deliver a portfolio of marketing events and campaigns &mdash; including trade shows, webinars, and customer engagement initiatives &mdash; to drive demand and revenue growth in the Africa region.
	Generate High-Quality Leads: Partner with Sales and Marketing teams to launch and manage integrated demand generation campaigns that nurture high-quality leads throughout the entire sales funnel.
	Localize Content and Messaging: Collaborate with content teams to adapt marketing materials, messaging, and customer success stories to reflect local market needs and cultural nuances.
	Manage External Communications: Build relationships with media outlets and industry influencers; oversee local PR efforts including press releases, media outreach, and event participation to enhance visibility and brand reputation.
	Track and Optimize ROI: Establish performance metrics for all marketing activities; regularly analyze lead quality, conversion rates, and campaign ROI to inform data-driven improvements.
	Budget Management: Oversee the regional marketing budget, ensuring effective cost control, accurate reporting, and financial accountability.
	Collaborate Across Teams: Build and maintain strong partnerships with regional sales leaders, product marketing, and senior management to ensure alignment on strategic GTM objectives.
	Maintain Market Expertise: Stay up to date with industry trends &mdash; including AI, customer experience (CX), data, and cybersecurity &mdash; to continuously refine strategies and maintain a competitive edge.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Economics, or a related field &ndash; required.
	5&ndash;9 years of experience in marketing management, field marketing, or go-to-market strategy within a B2B or technology environment.
	Master&rsquo;s degree &ndash; preferred.
	Certification in Digital Marketing &ndash; advantageous.
	Proven success in developing and executing integrated marketing programs that drive measurable results.
	Experience in regional or international markets, preferably within Africa.
	Strategic mindset combined with hands-on execution ability.
	Strong project management, organizational, and multitasking skills.
	Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
	Proficiency with marketing automation platforms (e.g., HubSpot).
	Experience using CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce, Microsoft Dynamics).
	Strong analytical and data-driven decision-making capabilities.
	Financial acumen and budget management experience.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in cross-functional teams.
	Keen attention to detail and commitment to excellence.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-11-07",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-08",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "TeKnowledge"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",

      "@type": "PostalAddress",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

    "value": "190063"
  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",

    }

}



Marketing Manager Job at TeKnowledge




        
    

        
        At TeKnowledge, we turn complexity into clarity – and potential into progress. We go beyond problem-solving to transform how you grow. By blending cutting-edge technology with expert insight, we help enterprises, governments and tech vendors tackle their biggest challenges while preparing them for what’s next. From strategy to execution, we drive smarter, faster, and more sustained innovation—empowering organizations with the capability and control to lead with confidence.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Manager 

Job Id: 2025-17143
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Job type: Full-time

About the job
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We’re seeking an experienced and results-driven Marketing Manager – GTM (Go-to-Market) to join our Africa regional team. In this role, you’ll be responsible for developing and executing integrated field marketing programs that drive demand generation, revenue growth, and brand visibility across the African market.
	At TeKnowledge, your work makes an impact from day one. We partner with organizations to deliver AI-First Expert Technology Services that drive meaningful impact in AI, Customer Experience, and Cybersecurity. We turn complexity into clarity and potential into progress—in a place where people lead and tech empowers.


Responsibilities


	Develop and Execute Integrated GTM Programs: Plan, budget, and deliver a portfolio of marketing events and campaigns — including trade shows, webinars, and customer engagement initiatives — to drive demand and revenue growth in the Africa region.
	Generate High-Quality Leads: Partner with Sales and Marketing teams to launch and manage integrated demand generation campaigns that nurture high-quality leads throughout the entire sales funnel.
	Localize Content and Messaging: Collaborate with content teams to adapt marketing materials, messaging, and customer success stories to reflect local market needs and cultural nuances.
	Manage External Communications: Build relationships with media outlets and industry influencers; oversee local PR efforts including press releases, media outreach, and event participation to enhance visibility and brand reputation.
	Track and Optimize ROI: Establish performance metrics for all marketing activities; regularly analyze lead quality, conversion rates, and campaign ROI to inform data-driven improvements.
	Budget Management: Oversee the regional marketing budget, ensuring effective cost control, accurate reporting, and financial accountability.
	Collaborate Across Teams: Build and maintain strong partnerships with regional sales leaders, product marketing, and senior management to ensure alignment on strategic GTM objectives.
	Maintain Market Expertise: Stay up to date with industry trends — including AI, customer experience (CX), data, and cybersecurity — to continuously refine strategies and maintain a competitive edge.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Economics, or a related field – required.
	5–9 years of experience in marketing management, field marketing, or go-to-market strategy within a B2B or technology environment.
	Master’s degree – preferred.
	Certification in Digital Marketing – advantageous.
	Proven success in developing and executing integrated marketing programs that drive measurable results.
	Experience in regional or international markets, preferably within Africa.
	Strategic mindset combined with hands-on execution ability.
	Strong project management, organizational, and multitasking skills.
	Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
	Proficiency with marketing automation platforms (e.g., HubSpot).
	Experience using CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce, Microsoft Dynamics).
	Strong analytical and data-driven decision-making capabilities.
	Financial acumen and budget management experience.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in cross-functional teams.
	Keen attention to detail and commitment to excellence.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Loading Supervisor",
  "description": "Flour Mills of Nigeria Plc has been a part of the lives of Nigerians at home and abroad. Our global vision is to be a leading foods company in Africa providing high quality and affordable products in the most convenient ways to consumers through world class brands like Golden Penny Flour, Golden Penny Semovita, Goldenvita, Golden Pasta and Golden Noodles. The Company&#39;s flagship brand, Golden Penny, remains one of the best known and the preferred brands amongst bakers, confectioneries and consumers in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Loading Supervisor

Job Location:&nbsp;Apapa, Lagos

Purpose


	Supervise daily loading activities at the warehouse in line with stated policies, guidelines and procedures.


The Job&nbsp;


	Supervise loading and offloading operations and re-assign resources as required.
	Obtain and review daily work schedule, incoming truck schedules, Picking-list to effectively plan and prepare for each day&rsquo;s activities.
	Supervise receipt of all shipments and process receipts, noting and reporting on discrepancies and damages as applicable.
	Carry out safety inspection of loading/unloading, staging and inbound/outbound areas in the warehouse.
	Coordinate loaders on how to arrange goods in the truck to maximize truck space.
	Collaborate with security team to coordinate truck arrival, entry and exit.
	Maintain records of all activities and processes pertaining to the storehouse.
	Prepare activity reports as required for the attention of the Unit Head


Qualification and Experience


	OND or relevant qualification in Administration or any relevant discipline.
	Minimum of 2 years of relevant experience in similar role.


The Person Must:


	Have excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Have an Inquisitive mind set with willingness and ability to learn quickly.
	Have a high degree of diligence, commitment and good self-hygiene.
	Have ability to work with minimal supervision and good attention to detail.
	Be disciplined and familiar with ethical of warehouse operations.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-11-07",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-08",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Flour Mills of Nigeria Plc"
    
  },

Loading Supervisor Job at Flour Mills of Nigeria Plc




        
    

        
        Flour Mills of Nigeria Plc has been a part of the lives of Nigerians at home and abroad. Our global vision is to be a leading foods company in Africa providing high quality and affordable products in the most convenient ways to consumers through world class brands like Golden Penny Flour, Golden Penny Semovita, Goldenvita, Golden Pasta and Golden Noodles. The Company's flagship brand, Golden Penny, remains one of the best known and the preferred brands amongst bakers, confectioneries and consumers in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Loading Supervisor

Job Location: Apapa, Lagos

Purpose
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Supervise daily loading activities at the warehouse in line with stated policies, guidelines and procedures.


The Job 


	Supervise loading and offloading operations and re-assign resources as required.
	Obtain and review daily work schedule, incoming truck schedules, Picking-list to effectively plan and prepare for each day’s activities.
	Supervise receipt of all shipments and process receipts, noting and reporting on discrepancies and damages as applicable.
	Carry out safety inspection of loading/unloading, staging and inbound/outbound areas in the warehouse.
	Coordinate loaders on how to arrange goods in the truck to maximize truck space.
	Collaborate with security team to coordinate truck arrival, entry and exit.
	Maintain records of all activities and processes pertaining to the storehouse.
	Prepare activity reports as required for the attention of the Unit Head


Qualification and Experience


	OND or relevant qualification in Administration or any relevant discipline.
	Minimum of 2 years of relevant experience in similar role.


The Person Must:


	Have excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Have an Inquisitive mind set with willingness and ability to learn quickly.
	Have a high degree of diligence, commitment and good self-hygiene.
	Have ability to work with minimal supervision and good attention to detail.
	Be disciplined and familiar with ethical of warehouse operations.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Cost Accountant",
  "description": "Sky Mall is a family-friendly destination for entertainment, leisure and shopping, situated on Lekki-Epe Expressway in the Sangotedo axis of Lagos. It is home to various brands and businesses offering top quality goods and services on a daily basis. Sky Mall is divided into two sections: the main Shopping mall for shopping and recreation, and the Extension section which offers office spaces. The mall boasts an opulent decor and wide of range of shops, office spaces, warehouses, top-notch restaurants, exclusive VIP lounges, cinemas, and a terrace bar.&nbsp;We provide easy movements from the ground floor to the top floor of the mall by stationing two elevators and three escalators within the shopping mall.&nbsp;

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cost Accountant
Job Location:&nbsp;Sangotedo, Eti-Osa - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Duties
Cost Analysis:


	Conduct detailed analysis of manufacturing costs, including direct labor, direct materials, and overhead expenses.
	Regularly review and update cost estimates for new and existing products vs expectations.
	Analyse variances between actual and standard costs, identifying and investigating any discrepancies.
	Regularly review the BOM to ensure accuracy with what is happening on the production floor.


Inventory Management:


	Oversee the valuation of inventory and ensure accurate recording in the financial statements.
	Collaborate with the production team to reconcile physical inventory with accounting records.
	Observe and review the inventory processing procedures regularly i.e. Receiving, Inter-warehouse transfers, daily production reconciliation, issues to production etc.
	Implement and maintain effective inventory control measures.


Financial Reporting:


	Prepare and present regular financial reports related to manufacturing costs to management.
	Provide insights and recommendations based on cost analysis to support strategic decision-making.
	Assist in the preparation of budgets and forecasts related to manufacturing activities.


Month-end Close:


	Play a key role in the month-end closing process, ensuring accurate and timely financial reporting.
	Reconcile general ledger accounts related to manufacturing costs.
	Process Improvement:
	Identify opportunities for cost reduction and operational efficiency within the manufacturing process.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement process improvements and cost-saving initiatives.


Compliance:


	Ensure compliance with relevant accounting standards and regulations.
	Assist in internal and external audits related to manufacturing costs.


Communication and Collaboration:


	Collaborate with various departments, including production, procurement, and finance, to gather relevant cost information.
	Communicate effectively with team members and stakeholders, providing insights and answering inquiries related to manufacturing costs.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor&#39;s Degree / HND with 3 - 5 years experience.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 per month

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;g.nwogwor@bildiamo.com&nbsp;,&nbsp;j.omefe@bildiamo.com&nbsp;and&nbsp;admin@bildiamo.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Application for Cost Accountant&quot; as the subject of the email.

Cost Accountant Job at Sky Mall




        
    

        
        Sky Mall is a family-friendly destination for entertainment, leisure and shopping, situated on Lekki-Epe Expressway in the Sangotedo axis of Lagos. It is home to various brands and businesses offering top quality goods and services on a daily basis. Sky Mall is divided into two sections: the main Shopping mall for shopping and recreation, and the Extension section which offers office spaces. The mall boasts an opulent decor and wide of range of shops, office spaces, warehouses, top-notch restaurants, exclusive VIP lounges, cinemas, and a terrace bar. We provide easy movements from the ground floor to the top floor of the mall by stationing two elevators and three escalators within the shopping mall. 
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cost Accountant
Job Location: Sangotedo, Eti-Osa - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Duties
Cost Analysis:


	Conduct detailed analysis of manufacturing costs, including direct labor, direct materials, and overhead expenses.
	Regularly review and update cost estimates for new and existing products vs expectations.
	Analyse variances between actual and standard costs, identifying and investigating any discrepancies.
	Regularly review the BOM to ensure accuracy with what is happening on the production floor.


Inventory Management:


	Oversee the valuation of inventory and ensure accurate recording in the financial statements.
	Collaborate with the production team to reconcile physical inventory with accounting records.
	Observe and review the inventory processing procedures regularly i.e. Receiving, Inter-warehouse transfers, daily production reconciliation, issues to production etc.
	Implement and maintain effective inventory control measures.


Financial Reporting:


	Prepare and present regular financial reports related to manufacturing costs to management.
	Provide insights and recommendations based on cost analysis to support strategic decision-making.
	Assist in the preparation of budgets and forecasts related to manufacturing activities.


Month-end Close:


	Play a key role in the month-end closing process, ensuring accurate and timely financial reporting.
	Reconcile general ledger accounts related to manufacturing costs.
	Process Improvement:
	Identify opportunities for cost reduction and operational efficiency within the manufacturing process.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement process improvements and cost-saving initiatives.


Compliance:


	Ensure compliance with relevant accounting standards and regulations.
	Assist in internal and external audits related to manufacturing costs.


Communication and Collaboration:


	Collaborate with various departments, including production, procurement, and finance, to gather relevant cost information.
	Communicate effectively with team members and stakeholders, providing insights and answering inquiries related to manufacturing costs.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree / HND with 3 - 5 years experience.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 per month

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: g.nwogwor@bildiamo.com , j.omefe@bildiamo.com and admin@bildiamo.com using “Application for Cost Accountant" as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Farm Manager",
  "description": "Wholesome Foods Limited is an Agro Processing Firms with interests in Manufacturing and Farming in Nigeria

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Farm Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Epe, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	We are in need of a Farm Manager to manage a farm on a large hectare basis.


Qualifications and Requirements


	OND / HND in Agronomy, Crop Science, Agricultural Science, or a related field.
	3 &ndash; 5 years of hands-on experience in crop production, farm management, or agronomy.
	Proven experience managing large-scale farms or commercial agricultural operations is highly desirable.


Skills and Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of soil science, crop nutrition, irrigation systems, and pest management.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and organizational skills.
	Ability to manage budgets, logistics, and multiple farm projects simultaneously.
	Practical understanding of climate-smart and sustainable farming practices.


Key Personal Attributes:


	Passion for agriculture and innovation.
	Attention to detail and problem-solving ability.
	Strong leadership and interpersonal skills.
	Integrity, accountability, and commitment to results.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;happicrunch@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Farm Manager Job at Wholesome Foods Limited




        
    

        
        Wholesome Foods Limited is an Agro Processing Firms with interests in Manufacturing and Farming in Nigeria

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Farm Manager

Job Location: Epe, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	We are in need of a Farm Manager to manage a farm on a large hectare basis.


Qualifications and Requirements
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	OND / HND in Agronomy, Crop Science, Agricultural Science, or a related field.
	3 – 5 years of hands-on experience in crop production, farm management, or agronomy.
	Proven experience managing large-scale farms or commercial agricultural operations is highly desirable.


Skills and Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of soil science, crop nutrition, irrigation systems, and pest management.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and organizational skills.
	Ability to manage budgets, logistics, and multiple farm projects simultaneously.
	Practical understanding of climate-smart and sustainable farming practices.


Key Personal Attributes:


	Passion for agriculture and innovation.
	Attention to detail and problem-solving ability.
	Strong leadership and interpersonal skills.
	Integrity, accountability, and commitment to results.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: happicrunch@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Oracle Developer",
  "description": "Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Oracle Developer
Job Location:&nbsp;Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Mode: Fully Onsite

Job Summary


	We are seeking a skilled and experienced Oracle Developer to design, develop, and maintain robust database systems.
	The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience in PL/SQL programming, performance tuning, and database optimization to ensure high availability and reliability of applications.


Key Responsibilities


	Design, develop, and implement Oracle database solutions using PL/SQL (stored procedures, triggers, packages).
	Optimize SQL queries and perform database performance tuning.
	Develop and maintain data models, schemas, and relationships to ensure data integrity and efficiency.
	Collaborate with application developers to integrate databases with business applications.
	Manage database security, backups, and recovery processes.
	Troubleshoot database issues and ensure optimal performance.
	Support data migration, transformation, and integration activities when required.
	Document database designs, configurations, and procedures.


Requirements
Education &amp; Certifications:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s or Master&rsquo;s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
	Oracle SQL/PLSQL Developer Certification (OCA/OCP) is an added advantage.


Required Skills &amp; Qualifications:


	Minimum of 3 years of experience in Oracle database development.
	Strong proficiency in PL/SQL programming.
	Solid understanding of SQL optimization and performance tuning.
	Experience with Oracle Database versions (11g, 12c).
	Good knowledge of database normalization, indexing, and partitioning.
	Familiarity with Oracle Forms, Reports, or APEX (preferred but not mandatory).
	Exposure to ETL tools, data migration, and system integration (an advantage).
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to work efficiently in an agile, team-oriented environment.


Salary
N400,000 &ndash; N500,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruiter13@ascentech.com.ng&nbsp;using &ldquo;Oracle Developer &ndash; Surulere&rdquo; as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-12-08",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Ascentech Services Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {

Oracle Developer Job at Ascentech Services Limited




        
    

        
        Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Oracle Developer
Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Mode: Fully Onsite

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a skilled and experienced Oracle Developer to design, develop, and maintain robust database systems.
	The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience in PL/SQL programming, performance tuning, and database optimization to ensure high availability and reliability of applications.


Key Responsibilities


	Design, develop, and implement Oracle database solutions using PL/SQL (stored procedures, triggers, packages).
	Optimize SQL queries and perform database performance tuning.
	Develop and maintain data models, schemas, and relationships to ensure data integrity and efficiency.
	Collaborate with application developers to integrate databases with business applications.
	Manage database security, backups, and recovery processes.
	Troubleshoot database issues and ensure optimal performance.
	Support data migration, transformation, and integration activities when required.
	Document database designs, configurations, and procedures.


Requirements
Education & Certifications:


	Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
	Oracle SQL/PLSQL Developer Certification (OCA/OCP) is an added advantage.


Required Skills & Qualifications:


	Minimum of 3 years of experience in Oracle database development.
	Strong proficiency in PL/SQL programming.
	Solid understanding of SQL optimization and performance tuning.
	Experience with Oracle Database versions (11g, 12c).
	Good knowledge of database normalization, indexing, and partitioning.
	Familiarity with Oracle Forms, Reports, or APEX (preferred but not mandatory).
	Exposure to ETL tools, data migration, and system integration (an advantage).
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to work efficiently in an agile, team-oriented environment.


Salary
N400,000 – N500,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruiter13@ascentech.com.ng using “Oracle Developer – Surulere” as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply
